<a id="CharFXTransform"></a>

# CharFXTransform

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Controls how an individual character will be displayed in a [RichTextEffect](RichTextEffect.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

By setting various properties on this object, you can control how individual characters will be displayed in a [RichTextEffect](RichTextEffect.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [BBCode in RichTextLabel](../tutorials/ui/bbcode_in_richtextlabel.md)

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_color"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **color** = `Color(0, 0, 0, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_color)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_color**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_color**\ (\ )

The color the character will be drawn with.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_elapsed_time"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **elapsed_time** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_elapsed_time)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_elapsed_time**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_elapsed_time**\ (\ )

The time elapsed since the [RichTextLabel](RichTextLabel.md) was added to the scene tree (in seconds). Time stops when the [RichTextLabel](RichTextLabel.md) is paused (see [Node.process_mode](Node.md#Node_property_process_mode)). Resets when the text in the [RichTextLabel](RichTextLabel.md) is changed.

\ **Note:** Time still passes while the [RichTextLabel](RichTextLabel.md) is hidden.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_env"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **env** = `{}` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_env)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_environment**\ (\ value\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\ )
- [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **get_environment**\ (\ )

Contains the arguments passed in the opening BBCode tag. By default, arguments are strings; if their contents match a type such as [bool](bool.md), [int](int.md) or [float](float.md), they will be converted automatically. Color codes in the form ``#rrggbb`` or ``#rgb`` will be converted to an opaque [Color](Color.md). String arguments may not contain spaces, even if they're quoted. If present, quotes will also be present in the final string.

For example, the opening BBCode tag ``[example foo=hello bar=true baz=42 color=#ffffff]`` will map to the following [Dictionary](Dictionary.md):

```
    {"foo": "hello", "bar": true, "baz": 42, "color": Color(1, 1, 1, 1)}
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_font"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[RID](RID.md) **font** = `RID()` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_font)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_font**\ (\ value\: [RID](RID.md)\ )
- [RID](RID.md) **get_font**\ (\ )

[TextServer](TextServer.md) RID of the font used to render glyph, this value can be used with ``TextServer.font_*`` methods to retrieve font information.

\ **Note:** Read-only. Setting this property won't affect drawing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_glyph_count"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **glyph_count** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_glyph_count)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_glyph_count**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_glyph_count**\ (\ )

Number of glyphs in the grapheme cluster. This value is set in the first glyph of a cluster.

\ **Note:** Read-only. Setting this property won't affect drawing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_glyph_flags"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **glyph_flags** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_glyph_flags)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_glyph_flags**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_glyph_flags**\ (\ )

Glyph flags. See [GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) for more info.

\ **Note:** Read-only. Setting this property won't affect drawing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_glyph_index"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **glyph_index** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_glyph_index)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_glyph_index**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_glyph_index**\ (\ )

Glyph index specific to the [font](CharFXTransform.md#CharFXTransform_property_font). If you want to replace this glyph, use [TextServer.font_get_glyph_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_index) with [font](CharFXTransform.md#CharFXTransform_property_font) to get a new glyph index for a single character.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_offset"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **offset** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_offset)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_offset**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_offset**\ (\ )

The position offset the character will be drawn with (in pixels).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_outline"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **outline** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_outline)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_outline**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_outline**\ (\ )

If ``true``, FX transform is called for outline drawing.

\ **Note:** Read-only. Setting this property won't affect drawing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_range"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **range** = `Vector2i(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_range)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_range**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_range**\ (\ )

Absolute character range in the string, corresponding to the glyph.

\ **Note:** Read-only. Setting this property won't affect drawing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_relative_index"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **relative_index** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_relative_index)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_relative_index**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_relative_index**\ (\ )

The character offset of the glyph, relative to the current [RichTextEffect](RichTextEffect.md) custom block.

\ **Note:** Read-only. Setting this property won't affect drawing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_transform"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **transform** = `Transform2D(1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_transform)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_transform**\ (\ value\: [Transform2D](Transform2D.md)\ )
- [Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **get_transform**\ (\ )

The current transform of the current glyph. It can be overridden (for example, by driving the position and rotation from a curve). You can also alter the existing value to apply transforms on top of other effects.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CharFXTransform_property_visible"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **visible** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#CharFXTransform_property_visible)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_visibility**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_visible**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the character will be drawn. If ``false``, the character will be hidden. Characters around hidden characters will reflow to take the space of hidden characters. If this is not desired, set their [color](CharFXTransform.md#CharFXTransform_property_color) to ``Color(1, 1, 1, 0)`` instead.
